TopicTitle: Looking for a mod that autobalances thrusters on the fly.

Articles.Content:
For A-symetrical shuttle setups.. Anything thats quick and easy? I tried Davon throttle control, but for some reason, it doesn't seem like it wants to work. Lots of options in there, but would prefer something that just "Does it" If you catch my drift..lol.. anything like that available?

- - - Updated - - -

nvm. found one. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/107802

How do you people get that fancy "- - - Updated - - -" line?

I always have to write a huge and ugly "EDIT:" in my posts.

@astropapi1: The updated line gets added automatically if you add a new post after your previous one before someone else comments in the thread. It's the forum software combining your posts instead of having two posts.

@Talavar: I do recommend Davon Throttle Control even though, it is more complicated, for the fact that you can assign only some engines to thrust balance and that it offers multiple groups of throttles. Makes life a lot easier for VTOLs that can thrust balance their downwards pointing engines on one throttle and then throttle up their horizontal flight engines once they reach altitude on a separate throttle without comprimising the thrust balance.

D.
